intro: Myosotis lutea var. versicolor, commonly known as the yellow forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that often blend with blue or white varieties. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in a fine layer of downy hair, while its stems are slender and often hairy. The flowers bloom in early spring and are pollinated primarily by bees and other small insects.
